item.title: Twitter now requires an account to view tweets
item.description: - Twitter now requires users to have an account in order to view tweets, meaning that if you're not logged in, you'll be prompted to sign in.

item.title: Apollo is dead. Long live Apollo
item.description: - The post discusses the end of the Apollo project and the implications for the tech industry.

item.title: Terrible real estate agent photographs
item.description: - The post discusses terrible photographs taken by real estate agents.

item.title: Hurl 4.0.0
item.description: - Hurl 4.0.0 is a command line tool that allows users to run HTTP requests defined in a simple text format.

item.title: Anna's Archive: Open-source data library
item.description: - The website "annas-archive.org" requires a security review before it can be accessed.

item.title: MdBook â€“ A command line tool to create books with Markdown
item.description: - MdBook is a command line tool that helps create books with Markdown, making it easy to create product or API documentation, tutorials, and course materials.

item.title: Case study: Algorithmic trading with Go
item.description: - This case study explores the development of an automated retail trading bot using the programming language Go.

item.title: How the great firewall of China detects & blocks fully encrypted traffic [pdf]
item.description: - The article explores algorithmic trading with Go and provides practical insights into its development and implementation.

item.title: File for divorce from LLVM
item.description: - The proposal suggests removing LLVM, Clang, and LLD libraries from the Zig project.

item.title: Microwaved plastic containers release microplastics into food
